Key Arguments: The definitions of misinformation and disinformation in the bill are too vague.
The bill inadequately defines what constitutes harm.
There is a lack of excluded content in the bill.
The bill grants excessive control over digital platforms.
The bill infringes on freedom of speech and access to information.
The bill could lead to government overreach and censorship similar to authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: This bill renders onto ACMA the type of powers that mirrors the CCPâ€™s chokehold on the dissemination of information in China.
This bill is an abomination and if it is to pass, it will see the descent of this great nation into fascism the likes of which even Stalin and Mao could not conceive of in their wildest dreams.
The community needs to be able to compare and evaluate information for themselves, and to do their own active critical thinking without being babied by the state.
